brewery.brewery_description: Following the closure of the Brakspear Brewery in Henley on Thames, Wychwood Brewery in Witney set up the Brakspear Brewing Company and took on the brewing of Brakspear Beers from its site in Witney, Oxfordshire.

beer.beer_description:
Cask 4.0% ABV; bottle 4.6% ABV.

This golden beer is craft brewed using the finest Crystal malts infused with Golding, Styrian Golding, Fuggle and Admiral hops. Over 200 years of brewing tradition has ensured Brakspear beers are renowned for what is best in English brewing.

items.badge_description: Want to enjoy a day of brews, but need to keep your wits sharp? There are plenty of delicious brews under 5% for you to sip on throughout the day. That's 10 different beers with an ABV of 5% and lower. Try 5 more for Level 3!

A traditional pale ale with a punchy hop finish and aroma. Finest quality roasted malts provide a subtle but full, malty, fruity background to showcase the herbal, berry flavours from traditional English hop varieties. Hoppy Holidays will pair well with sweet and fruity flavours; like glazed ham, chutneys, pickles and Christmas pudding.
Ruby ale with a hint of sweet fruits

Crafted with a blend of three malts and three hops to deliver a luxurious treat to savour.

Each bottle is individually numbered so that drinkers can track when each batch was brewed and bottled.

Bell St. Brewery's Golden Ale with a hint of honey. 
20p per pint sold going to Friends of The Earth's 'Bee Cause'.
English hops and barley mixed with a few American fellows to produce a hoppy, aromatic classic ale.
Craft brewed stout
Served at the porch house in stow on the wold
Very like regular Brakspear bitter but perhaps softer and more floral. Quite pleasant.
This light, golden beer has delicately subtle honey notes and a bracing delivery of hops.
Bitter, and easily drinkable
Warming Amber Ale served exclusively at the Hollybush
